net.alomax.math

Class TimeSeries

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.alomax.math.TimeSeries

  • public abstract class TimeSeries
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract base class representing a generic time series.

    Note: Extending classes must instantiate a numeric array to contain the time series samples.

    See Also:
    TimeSeriesFloat

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      java.lang.String timeUnits
      The time units (must be "Seconds").

      • calculateVariance

        public abstract double calculateVariance()
        Calculates and returns the variance of the time series samples.

        Calculates and returns the mean of the time series samples.

      • calculateRmsAmplitude

        public abstract double calculateRmsAmplitude(int startIndex,
                                             int endIndex)
        Calculates and returns the rms amplitude of a subset of the samples in this time series.

      • calculateAmplitudeRange

        public abstract RangeDouble calculateAmplitudeRange(int beginIndex,
                                                    int endIndex,
                                                    boolean setOutOfRangeValuesToZero)
        Calculates and returns the minimum and maximum amplitude in a subset of the time series samples. The subset begins at the specified beginIndex and extends to the sample at index endIndex - 1.
        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the beginning index, inclusive.
        endIndex - the ending index, exclusive.
        setOutOfRangeValuesToZero - if true sets out of range amplitude values in the time series to 0.0.
        Returns:
        the amplitude range.

      • calculateAndSetAmplitudeRange

        public abstract void calculateAndSetAmplitudeRange(boolean setOutOfRangeValuesToZero)
        Calculates and sets the minimum and maximum amplitude in the complete time series. Sets ampMin and ampMax.
        Parameters:
        setOutOfRangeValuesToZero - if true sets out of range amplitude values in the time series to 0.0.
        See Also:
        ampMin, ampMax

      • getSampleAsFloat

        public float[] getSampleAsFloat()
        Returns the samples as a float array.
        Returns:
        the samples as a float array or null if not implemented by an extending class.

      • getSampleSubsetAsFloat

        public float[] getSampleSubsetAsFloat(int beginIndex,
                                      int endIndex)
        Returns a new float array that is a subset of the samples in this time series. The subset begins at the specified beginIndex and extends to the sample at index endIndex - 1.
        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the beginning index, inclusive.
        endIndex - the ending index, exclusive.
        Returns:
        the subset of samples as a float array or null if not implemented by an extending class.

      • setSampleFloat

        public void setSampleFloat(float[] newSample)
        Sets a float array as the samples in this time series.

      • appendFloat

        public int appendFloat(int discardToIndex,
                       float[] appendArray,
                       int startIndexBeforeDiscard)
        Appends a float array to the samples in this time series.
        Parameters:
        discardToIndex - samples of the current time series up to this index (exclusive) will be discarded.
        appendArray - the array to append.
        startIndexBeforeDiscard - the index in the current time series (before discardin samples) to begin appending.
        Returns:
        the number of samples appended.

      • getSampleAsDouble

        public double[] getSampleAsDouble()
        Returns the samples as a double array.
        Returns:
        the samples as a double array or null if not implemented by an extending class.

      • getSampleSubsetAsDouble

                                        int endIndex)
        Returns a new double array that is a subset of the samples in this time series. The subset begins at the specified beginIndex and extends to the sample at index endIndex - 1.
        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the beginning index, inclusive.
        endIndex - the ending index, exclusive.
        Returns:
        the subset of samples as a double array or null if not implemented by an extending class.

      • sampleLength

        public abstract int sampleLength()
        Returns the time series sample length
        Returns:
        the number of samples.

      • sampleAt

        public abstract double sampleAt(int index)
        Returns a time series sample value.
        Parameters:
        index - the sample index.
        Returns:
        the sample value.

      • invertPolarity

        public abstract void invertPolarity()
        Inverts the polarity of the time series samples. Multiplies each sample by -1.

      • removeTrend

        public abstract void removeTrend()
        A least squares curve fit of a straight line to the data is calculated. This straight line or trend is then "subtracted" from the data.

      • removeMean

        public abstract void removeMean()
        Removes the mean of the time series samples. updates ampMin, ampMax.

      • removeMean

        public abstract void removeMean(int nPointsFromBegin)
        Removes the mean of the time series samples. updates ampMin, ampMax.
        Parameters:
        nPointsFromBegin - the number of points from beginning of time series to use to calculate mean.

      • removeMean

        public abstract void removeMean(int nStart,
                                int nEnd)
        Removes the mean of the time series samples. updates ampMin, ampMax.
        Parameters:
        nStart - the start index of window to use to calculate mean.
        nEnd - the end index of window to use to calculate mean.

      • unDoRemoveMean

        public abstract void unDoRemoveMean()
        Undo the last remove mean. ampMin, ampMax.
        See Also:
        removeMean

      • cosineTaper

        public abstract void cosineTaper(double taperPercent)
        Applies a cosine taper to each end of the time series samples.
        Parameters:
        taperPercent - the amount of taper as percent of time series length

      • cutInMemory

        public abstract void cutInMemory(int startIndex,
                                 int endIndex)
        Cuts time range of time series from time1 to time2. Updates ampMin, ampMax, ampUnits.

      • test

        public abstract void test()
        Applies test time domain processing to a set of seismograms

      • integrate

        public abstract void integrate(float startValue)
        Applies time-domain integration to the time series samples. Uses trapeziod rule, replaces sample values with the integral. Updates ampMin, ampMax, ampUnits.

      • integrateMaxOfPosNeg

        public abstract double integrateMaxOfPosNeg(boolean peakOnly)
        Applies time-domain integration of maximum of positive and negatige samples to the time series samples. Integrates abs val of positive and negative values separately, loads case with maximum integral into samples
        Parameters:
        peakOnly - if true, then only returns integral of largest abs value of positive or negative peak
        Returns:
        the time window of integration for the maximum positive or negative value

      • differentiate

        public abstract void differentiate(float vlast)
        Applies time-domain differentiation to the time series samples. INVALID_AMPLITUDEfirst differences, replaces sample values with the dirivative. Updates ampMin, ampMax, ampUnits.
        Parameters:
        vlast -

      • multiply

        public abstract void multiply(double value)
        Multiply each of the time series samples by a constant value.
        Parameters:
        value - the multiplier value

      • log

        public abstract void log()
        Take the natural logarithm of each of the time series samples.

      • log10

        public abstract void log10()
        Take the base 10 logarithm of each of the time series samples.

      • sqrt

        public abstract void sqrt()
        Take square root of each of the time series samples.

      • norm

        public abstract void norm()
        Normalize each of the time series samples relative to its maximum abs.

      • chop

        public abstract void chop()
        Method to chop each of the time series samples (set equal to zero if negative)

      • multiplyLinear

        public abstract void multiplyLinear(double value1,
                                    double value2)
        Multiply each of the time series samples by a constant value which varies linearly.
        Parameters:
        value1 - the multiplier value at the first sample
        value2 - the multiplier value at the last sample

      • indexOfAmpZeroToPeakMax

        public int indexOfAmpZeroToPeakMax()
        Returns the index of the maximum zero-to-peak amplitude in the seismogram.
        Returns:
        the index of the maximum amplitude or -1 if not available

      • indicesOfAmpPeakToPeakMax

        public RangeInteger indicesOfAmpPeakToPeakMax(double timeWindowWidth)
        Returns the indices of the maximum peak-to-peak amplitude within a time window.
        Returns:
        the indices of the maximum amplitude or null if not available

      • indexOfCumulative

        public int indexOfCumulative(double value)
        Returns the index of the first occurence of the target cumulative value as a proportion of the maxium zero to peak value on the TimeSeries.
        Parameters:
        value - target cumulative value as a proportion of the value at the end of the TimeSeries
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurence of the value or -1 if not available

      • indexOfPivotLimit

        public int[] indexOfPivotLimit(int pivotIndex,
                               double linePivotDelay,
                               double distanceLimit,
                               double errorWidth)
        Returns (1) the index of the first value on the TimeSeries where a line from the pivot point is further from the value than distanceLimit proportion of its length, and (2) the index of the first value before (1) where the line from the pivot point is further from the value than distanceLimit - errorWidth proportion of its length
        Parameters:
        pivotIndex - index of the pivot point
        linePivotDelay - time delay from pivot point to start checking for distanceLimit
        distanceLimit - max distance of pivot line from values as a proportion of the height of the pivot line
        errorWidth - distance of pivot line from values for error determination as a proportion of the height of the pivot line
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurence of the value or -1 if not available
        See Also:
        TimeSeries

      • getFFT

        public abstract Cmplx[] getFFT(double taperPercent,
                               int trailingZeroPad)
        Performs FFT on time series and returns Complex spectrum.
        Parameters:
        taperPercent - the amount of taper as percent of time series length
        trailingZeroPad - the number of points of trailing zero padding to apply

      • applyFreqProcess

        public abstract void applyFreqProcess(FrequencyDomainProcess freqProcess,
                                      double taperPrecent,
                                      java.lang.Object[] params,
                                      boolean doFftInverse)
        Applies a frequency domain process to the time series samples.
        Parameters:
        freqProcess - the frequency domain process to apply.
        taperPercent - the amount of taper as percent of time series length
        params - process dependent parameters
        doFftInverse - if true, do inverse fft, if false do not do inverse fft - implies next operation is freq process that can start from complex fft array
        See Also:
        FrequencyDomainProcess

      • applyTimeDomainProcess

        public abstract void applyTimeDomainProcess(TimeDomainProcess timeProcess)
                                     throws TimeDomainException
        Applies a time domain process to the time series samples.
        Parameters:
        timeProcess - the time domain process to apply.
        Throws:
        TimeDomainException
        See Also:
        TimeDomainProcess

        Returns a string representation of the object.

        Returns:
        a string representation of the object
